4.text:
In 2004 a low budget science fiction film
took Sundance by storm.

9.text: Primer is quite possibly the most complex time travel film ever made;

14.text: with multiple time lines, multiple doubles and dishonesty between the key players.

19.text:
Film maker and former engineer Steve Carruth
determinedly refused to dumb down the dialogue

25.text:
to make the film easier to decipher. Instead
he decided to trust that his audience would

30.text:
return to the film again and again in order
to fully understand it.

35.text:
Today, I’ve decided to take a closer look
at Primer and break it all down.

39.text:
Obviously I’m going to assume you’ve already
seen this film and are reasonably familiar

43.text: with the events that take place within the story.

46.text:
Two friends, Abe and Aaron, have inadvertently
invented time travel and they initially intend

51.text:
to use their time machine to make money on
the stock market.

55.text:
If they follow a few simple rules everything
should work out fine, but over the course of

60.text:
only a handful of days, they deceive each other,
create multiple timelines and doubles and

65.text: in short mess things up pretty royally for themselves.

69.text:
The key to understanding Primer is to focus
on the people and things that matter

73.text:
and discard everything else - so with that in mind let’s
familiarize ourselves with the characters

79.text: in this story and decide who to pay attention to.

82.text:
There is Abe and Aaron who have discovered
time travel so they are obviously very important.

86.text:
There is Robert and Philip, they are colleagues
and friends of Abe and Aaron but they aren’t

91.text:
let in on the secret of time travel and have
little to no real effect on the story.

96.text:
Similarly you can dismiss Kara and Laney who
are Aaron’s wife and daughter respectively;

101.text: they too don’t effect the story in any major way.

105.text:
Then there is Rachel Granger. She is Abe’s
love interest although Abe seems to be using

110.text:
her to get close to her wealthy father Mr
Granger who Abe hopes will invest money into

117.text:
Although Mr Granger’s first appearance in
the film is fleeting, he turns out to be quite

124.text:
Rachel has a crazy ex boyfriend who still
holds a torch for her. In fact in the film

129.text:
Aaron attends a party where the ex turns up
and threatens Rachel with a shotgun.

134.text:
Luckily Aaron was a hero and successfully
disarmed the ex boyfriend.

138.text:
The incident at the party is a pivotal moment
in the film.

142.text:
And finally we have the character of Platt.
Platt is never actually seen in the film but

147.text:
he is referred to several times. Both Abe
and Aaron dislike him because in the past

153.text:
he cheated them out of a successful invention
and went onto make a lot of money for himself.

158.text:
Aaron mentions in the film how he would very
much like to punch Platt in the face.

163.text: "This is what I would do, I would wake up tomorrow morning, and I'd go over to Gabrielle Capital Inc.

170.text: and I would tell Joseph Platt's receptionist that I'm there to see him - and when he comes out,

176.text: I would ram my fist through the flat of his nose. Just one good punch - one good pow!"

185.text:
Platt, and Aaron’s desire to punch him is
also important to the story so remember him

192.text:
In summary the important characters and incidents
in the film are:

197.text: Rachel, her ex boyfriend and the incident at the party.

203.text: Platt, and Abe and Aaron’s desire to punch him.

206.text:
So, let’s talk about how this time machine
works, I’ll call it the box from now on

211.text: as that’s how it’s referred to in the film.

213.text:
The box must be switched on at the time you
want to travel back in time to.

217.text:
So this means if you wanted to time travel
back to Monday morning at 9am, you will first

223.text: need to turn the box on at Monday morning 9am.

226.text:
As Abe was the first person to figure out
how the box works, let's do a walkthrough of

231.text: an example of his first time traveling journey.

234.text: On Monday morning Abe switches on the box at 9am.

237.text: Abe then goes to a hotel room and locks himself away.

241.text:
The reason why Abe holes himself away in the
hotel room is because he does not want to

246.text:
influence the world in any way during the
next few hours.

249.text:
Abe then finds out what stocks have gone up in that
day - he will use this knowledge to make money

255.text:
on the markets when he repeats the day after
time traveling back.

258.text:
At 3pm Abe decides he’s ready to travel
back in time and he enters the box.

264.text:
The yellow line is our time line and its length
indicates roughly what time the event or incident

269.text: we are talking about happens during the day.

273.text:
Abe then spends 6 hrs in the box traveling
back in time to 9am that morning.

278.text:
So, now that Abe has traveled back, it’s
Monday morning take 2.

282.text:
At 9am there are two Abe’s in existence
at the same time, the one who is switching

288.text:
on the box and heading to the hotel and the
one who has just emerged from the box.

293.text:
To differentiate them, let’s call the original
Abe, Abe 0 and the double who has just emerged

300.text:
While Abe 0 is hiding away in the hotel
Abe 1 plays the stock markets.

306.text:
Abe 0 is hiding because both the Abes know
that as they share one identity they can’t

312.text:
both go around influencing the world at the
same time. So while Abe 1 uses his stock market

317.text:
knowledge to make money Abe 0 tries to
eliminate his influence on the world by hiding away.

324.text:
There can’t be two Abes in existence forever
but that’s not a problem, when Monday 3pm

329.text:
hits once again Abe 0 will get in the box
to begin his journey back to Monday 9am,

339.text: Meanwhile Abe 1 will continue to progress forward.

343.text:
Before any time traveling took place in the
film Abe 0 realized that there was a chance

348.text:
he or Aaron could cause havoc with time lines
and their futures so he took the precaution

356.text:
This failsafe box is another time traveling
box that was switched on early Monday morning,

362.text:
Abe 0 hid this failsafe box away and kept
it in case things went horribly wrong.

368.text:
If there was an emergency a future Abe - lets
dub him Abe F for the purposes of the illustration

373.text:
- could use this failsafe box at any time;
he could go all the way back to Monday morning

379.text:
before he had ever started to time travel
and prevent Abe 0 from entering the box

386.text:
If that set of circumstances were to play
out there would result in two Abes being present

390.text:
in the same timeline at the same time. So
future Abe who has come back to stop all the

395.text:
time traveling and Abe 0 who has yet to
start time traveling

398.text: are present in the same instance.

401.text:
This of course creates a problem, they can’t
go about living a life with one identity between them.

406.text:
If a future Abe had to come back to
the very beginning,  one of the Abes would have

411.text:
to disappear and create an entirely new life
for themselves.

416.text:
So now that we have established how time travel
works, let’s unravel the series of events

423.text:
A few liberties will be taken here to make
it easier to explain.

427.text:
First, all the times will be rounded off and
second, there will be a few assumptions with

432.text:
regards to what happens during some periods
which are not shown in the film, because as

437.text:
anyone who has seen the film will know, not
everything that matters to the story is shown,

442.text: some incidents are only alluded to.

445.text:
And finally, in this break down I have assumed
the minimum number of time traveling journeys

449.text: necessary for all the events in the story to fit.

452.text:
So, with all of that being said let’s follow
Abe and Aaron from Monday through to Friday.

458.text:
Monday, 5am - Abe 0 turns on the failsafe box and
leaves it hidden away.

464.text:
9am - Abe 0 turns on the box he will be
using to time travel back to Monday 9am.

470.text:
Abe 0 spends the rest of the day holed
up in a hotel.

474.text:
3pm - Abe 0 returns to the box and climbs
in. He is going to travel back to the morning.

480.text:
After 6 hours in the box Abe emerges but this
time he is Abe 1.

484.text:
It is 9am on Monday morning once again and
Abe 1 will be able to live out the next 6hrs

491.text:
once more, while Abe 0 is on his way to
the hotel where he will hide out.

495.text:
Abe 1 makes his way to Aaron who is sitting  
on a bench apparently listening to March madness.

501.text:
Abe 1 reveals all to his friend. As Aaron
will begin time traveling pretty soon

508.text:
During the day Abe 1 slowly introduces Aaron
0 to the concept of time traveling.

514.text:
In between all of this, at some point, Aaron
0 plays basketball with a friend and invites

519.text:
him to a party later that night and also tells
him to bring along Rachel’s ex

525.text:
At 3pm Abe 1 takes Aaron 0 to the place
where he keeps the time traveling boxes

530.text:
and they witness Abe 0 just as he’s getting ready
to go into the box

534.text: to begin his journey to the past.

536.text:
Later that evening Aaron 0 attends the
party he invited his friend to earlier in the day.

542.text:
Abe 1 is not present and in the film
we don’t actually see what took place at

546.text:
the party, but from later conversations we
understand that at the party Rachel’s volatile

551.text: ex threatened people with a shotgun and Aaron 0 managed to disarm him.

556.text: Tuesday - Aaron 0 has decided he also wants to time travel, and make money on the stock markets.

563.text:
So at 9am both Abe 1 and Aaron 0 switch
on their boxes and hole away at a hotel.

568.text:
At 3pm Abe 1 and Aaron 0 get into the box
and time travel back to 9am that same morning.

575.text: They emerge from their boxes as Abe 2 and Aaron 1.

582.text:
While Abe 1 and Aaron 0 once more make
their way to the hotel,

586.text: Abe 2 and Aaron 1 make money on the stock market.

590.text:
Once 3pm hits Abe 1 and Aaron 0 get into
their boxes and disappear into the past and

596.text: Abe 2 and Aaron 1 go back to living their lives.

600.text: And now here’s where it is going to get complicated.

602.text:
Aaron 1 has found out about the failsafe but
has kept quiet about his knowledge.

608.text:
And at some point on Tuesday Aaron 1 decides
that he needs to use the failsafe and go back

616.text: Now the reason for this seems to be about Rachel’s ex.

619.text:
It appears that Aaron 1 is not satisfied with
the outcome of the party - he believes the

623.text: ex is still a danger and presumably wants to come back

626.text: in order to deal with the ex more effectively.

629.text:
So Aaron 1 uses the failsafe box and returns
to Monday morning 5am. He emerges as Aaron 2.

636.text:
Aaron 2 sets up two disassembled time traveling
boxes he has brought back with him. He immediately

641.text:
switches them on, one is for him and one is
for Abe. These boxes will allow them to come

646.text: back once more to Monday 5am should they need to.

650.text:
Aaron 2 plans to replay and record the day
in order to repeat Monday as often as he needs

655.text: to in order to get rid of the ex for good.

658.text: But there is a serious repercussion to Aaron 2’s plan.

662.text:
On Monday morning 5am he exists at the same
time as Aaron 0 who at this point is blissfully

668.text:
unaware of anything related to time travel
as Abe 1 has not had his conversation with

675.text:
In order to make sure that Aaron 2 can go
through Monday and record all of the pivotal

679.text:
conversations, Aaron 2 needs
to knock Aaron 0 out of the equation and

686.text:
He does this by drugging his breakfast and
storing Aaron 0 away in his attic.

691.text:
At 9am Abe 1 returns to Monday 9am, while Abe
0 holes away at the hotel.

697.text: Aaron 2 waits for Abe 1 to meet him at the bench.

701.text:
Remember the first time we ran through Monday,
Aaron 0 appeared to be listening to March

706.text:
madness. Well guess what? He wasn’t; he was
actually recording his conversation with Abe 1.

712.text:
The Aaron 0 we thought we saw was actually
Aaron 2 in the film. In fact we never really

718.text: saw the very first time Abe 1 talked to Aaron 0 about time travel - we only see the version

724.text:
where Aaron 2 has come back and is recording
their conversation.

727.text: Abe 1 and Aaron 2 then live out Monday once again.

730.text:
Aaron 2 again invites his friend and Rachel's
ex to the party that will be held later that night.

736.text: At 3pm they once more watch as Abe 0 gets in the box.

740.text:
And in the evening Aaron 2 once again attends
the party where he disarms Rachel’s ex.

749.text:
At 9am Abe 1 and Aaron 2 switch on the boxes
and hole away in a hotel and wait for 3pm.

757.text:
At 3pm they time travel back to Tuesday 9am,
becoming Abe 2 and Aaron 3.

764.text:
As Abe 1 and Aaron 2 hole away in the hotel
Abe 2 and Aaron 3 play the markets.

770.text:
At 3pm Abe 1 and Aaron 2 enter the boxes and
disappear into the past.

775.text:
Abe 2 and Aaron 3 go home to spend the evening
hanging out at Aaron 3’s home.

781.text:
There they discuss the implications of time
travel with Aaron 3’s wife in a roundabout way.

786.text:
This is when Aaron 3 confesses how much he
would love to experience punching Platt in

791.text:
the face just once, and then he would go back
in time and tell himself not to do it.

796.text:
Abe 2 is concerned about the idea because
it would mean Aaron 3 speaking with his double

801.text:
and they simply don’t understand the repercussions
that would come from that.

805.text:
During this conversation Aaron 3’s wife
mentions hearing rats in the attic and Aaron 3

810.text:
brushes it off. Those rats are in fact Aaron
0 who is still trapped in the attic.

816.text:
At this point it’s not clear what Aaron
3 intends to do with Aaron 0; as we have previously

821.text: discussed both can’t exist in the same timeframe indefinitely.

826.text: Aaron 3's wife: "Did you called pest control?"

829.text: Aaron 3: "Babe they're birds. You don't want a bunch of dead baby birds up there do you?"

832.text: Aaron 3's wife: "They don't sound like birds."

835.text: Aaron 3: "She thinks there are rats in the attic."

837.text:
At 9am Abe 2 and Aaron 3 switch on their boxes
and as is becoming routine for them they hole

843.text: themselves away in a hotel room.

845.text:
They discuss the fact that Aaron 3 has not
revealed anything to his wife and interestingly

850.text:
Aaron 3 mentions that he might fly himself
and his family away to Costa Rica.

855.text:
Is this a clue to Aaron 3’s ultimate plan?
Is he intending to take his family away and

861.text:
leave Aaron 0 in the attic? It’s not
clear, but it could be a possibility.

867.text:
At 3pm Abe 2 and Aaron 3 return to their boxes
and make the trip back to 9am that morning

876.text:
Back at 9am Abe 2 and Aaron 3 are on their
way to the hotel and Abe 3 and Aaron 4 play

884.text:
That particular day, a troubling thing happens
to Aaron 4; he starts bleeding from his ear.

890.text:
This is presumably because time travel has
a bad effect on the time traveler.

895.text: Aaron 4 by this point has time traveled multiple times.

898.text:
At 3pm their doubles, Abe 2 and Aaron 3 go
into their boxes and Abe 3 and Aaron 4

906.text:
Later that same day Abe 3 learns of the Monday
night party incident and he berates Aaron 4

911.text: for risking his life in that manner.

916.text:
At 9am Abe 3 and Aaron 4 switch on their boxes
and make their way to the hotel.

921.text:
There Aaron 4 receives and takes a call from
his wife. This is a problem, both Abe 3 and

928.text:
Aaron 4 want to have as little effect on the
world around them as possible from the time

933.text: of switching on their boxes to entering them.

936.text:
Abe 3 comes up with a solution, if Aaron 4
makes sure not to take his phone back with

941.text:
him to Thursday morning when he becomes Aaron 5
everything will be ok. They figure the next

947.text: instance when Aaron 4’s wife calls the double in the hotel room will pick up and have the same conversation

955.text:
At 3pm Abe 3 and Aaron 4 get into their boxes
and emerge as Abe 4 and Aaron 5

963.text:
Back at 9am Abe 3 and Aaron 4 are on their
way to the hotel and Abe 4 and Aaron 5 play

970.text:
But foolishly Aaron 5 has brought his phone
with him so when his phone rings they realize

975.text:
that Aaron 4 who is holed up in the hotel
room has not received the call

981.text:
They have broken symmetry and are a little
frightened of the repercussions but there

986.text: is nothing immediate that happens so they calm down.

989.text:
At 3pm their doubles, Abe 3 and Aaron 4 go
into the boxes and Abe 4 and Aaron 5

999.text:
On Friday Abe 4 and Aaron 5’s routine changes
because Abe 4 is woken by some children playing

1004.text: about with car alarms at 3am in the morning.

1007.text:
There are two things that have been playing on Abe
4’s mind. First, the conversation between

1012.text:
him and Aaron 3 back on Tuesday about punching
Platt in the face and second, the breaking

1018.text:
of symmetry that happened with the phone call
on Thursday.

1021.text:
Abe has been secretly turning on the time
traveling boxes at 5pm in the evenings, so

1026.text:
the previous day, on Thursday 5pm he turned
on the boxes.

1030.text:
At 3am on Friday Abe 4 comes up with a plan,
if he and and Aaron 5 go to Platt’s house

1035.text:
now and punch him in the face they can use
the boxes to return to 5pm on Thursday evening

1043.text:
They can then hide away until 3am Friday morning
and scare away the kids from playing with

1048.text:
the car alarms which will in turn prevent
his double from waking up and coming up with

1053.text: the plan of punching Platt in the face.

1055.text:
This way they can kill two birds with one
stone, experience the pleasure of punching

1059.text:
Platt in the face and test what happens if
symmetry is broken.

1063.text:
So that’s the plan but it doesn’t quite pan
out. Let’s go back to Friday 3am when Abe 4

1068.text:
is woken up and had the original idea of
punching Platt.

1072.text:
As he and Aaron 5 are traveling to Platt’s
house they spot Mr Granger.

1077.text: Earlier that day Aaron 5 had seen Mr Granger with a cleanly shaven face but that evening Mr Granger seems

1083.text:
to be sporting around three days worth of growth
and he looks dishevelled and unkempt.

1088.text:
To their panic Abe 4 and Aaron 5 realize that
Granger has somehow found out about the time

1093.text: traveling boxes and has used one.

1096.text:
This scares Abe 4 so much that he decides
it’s time to use his original failsafe,

1101.text: or what he thinks is his original failsafe. Remember that Aaron 2 replaced Abe's failsafe.

1108.text: Abe 4 plans to go back on Monday and stop Abe 0 and who he thinks is Aaron 0 from

1113.text: ever time traveling in the first place.

1115.text:
Aaron 5 independently also decides to go back
to Monday morning too.

1119.text: Although he doesn’t know for certain why Granger has come back

1122.text: he puts it down to something to do with Rachel and her ex.

1126.text:
He decides to come back on Monday and really ensure
that the ex gets locked up for good rather

1133.text: So once again, we’re back on Monday morning.

1136.text:
5am - Aaron 5 who entered his failsafe on
friday night emerges as Aaron 6.

1142.text: He then goes to his apartment where Aaron 2 has already taken care of Aaron 0 by

1148.text: He and Aaron 2 fight but Aaron 6 is unable to over power Aaron 2 and instead the two Aarons talk.

1155.text:
Aaron 6 explains that he has already recorded
all the conversations of the day, that he

1160.text:
has already disarmed rachel’s crazy ex but
that something went wrong in the future that

1164.text:
has caused Granger to start traveling back
in time. Aaron 6 tells Aaron 2 that he needs

1169.text:
to really ensure that Rachel’s ex is actually
locked up.

1174.text:
There are now three Aarons in the same timeline.
Aaron 0 in the attic, Aaron 2 and Aaron 6.

1180.text: Aaron 2 comes to realize that Aaron 6 is more invested

1184.text: in the plan and so he leaves.

1186.text:
Meanwhile Abe 4 who entered his failsafe on
friday night emerges as Abe 5.

1191.text:
Abe 5 then goes to Abe 0, gasses him and
stashes him in the bathroom to make sure he

1198.text: There are now two Abes in the same timeline.

1201.text:
Abe 5 and Aaron 6 meet up at the bench as
they did that very first Monday but this time

1206.text:
an extremely exhausted Abe 5 faints and the
time for putting everything out on the table

1212.text:
Aaron 6 tells Abe 5 everything he has done,
the additional time traveling, the setting

1217.text:
up of different failsafe boxes and trying
to fix things at the party.

1222.text:
Just as he has done every Monday prior to
this final Monday Aaron 6 plays basket ball

1226.text:
with his friend and invites him and Rachel’s
ex to the party later that day.

1230.text:
Aaron 6 manages to convince Abe 5 to agree
to help him with Rachel’s crazy ex and they

1236.text: both attend the party on Monday night.

1238.text:
And at last they are successful in fixing
things at the party.

1242.text:
The next morning after Aaron 6 has a good
night’s sleep and Abe 5 spends all night

1247.text: contemplating what has happened, they make their way to the airport.

1251.text: Aaron 6 is going to leave and make a new life

1253.text:
for himself. Aaron 0 who is locked in the
attic will presumably be found and allowed

1258.text: to continue on in relative ignorance.

1260.text:
Abe 5 decides that he’s going to stay and
ensure that Abe 0 doesn’t begin time

1265.text:
traveling at all. Aaron 6 thinks his attempts
will be futile and the two argue with Aaron 6

1270.text: making a dig about Abe 5 coveting his family.

1274.text:
The two friends separate, their relationship
irreparably damaged.

1279.text:
It seems obvious that time traveling causes
damage to the body;

1283.text: this is evidenced by Aaron 4’s ear beginning to bleed,

1286.text:
Abe 5 passing out and both Aarons
and Abes noticing that their handwriting deteriorates.

1293.text:
One theory as to why their handwriting suffers
so badly can be traced back to the day Aaron

1298.text:
and Abe are playing around with the box in
the garage, before any time traveling has taken place.

1303.text:
They both place their hands above
the box and in that moment their hands may

1307.text:
have traveled back in time while the rest
of their bodies remained in the present.

1312.text:
As a result, their hand may be a few moments
behind the rest of their bodies causing their hands

1317.text:
be out of sync and this in turn translates
into their inability to write properly.

1323.text:
The voice over narration that we hear is that
of Aaron 2 who left the story on that final

1328.text:
Monday morning after his fight and following
conversation with Aaron 6.

1333.text:
Aaron 2 felt he owed Aaron 0, who he drugged
and locked in the attic some kind of explanation

1339.text: and that is the purpose of his phone call.

1341.text: *PHONE RINGS* Aaron 2: 'Here's what's going to happen; I'm going to read this and you're going to listen.

1348.text: And you're going to stay on the line and you're not going interrupt, you're not going to speak for any reason.

1354.text: Some of this you know. Now, I'm going to start at the top of the page."

1358.text:
This is why Aaron 2 is unable to relay accurately
what happened at the party on that final Monday night.

1364.text:
It was Aaron 6 who attended it along
with Abe 5.

1368.text: In the final moments of the film we see Aaron 2 in a foreign country and not having learned his lesson,

1373.text: he seems to be in the process of building a much larger box.

1377.text:
So that concludes my explanation and analysis
of Primer, arguably the most challenging time

1383.text:
travel film ever made. I hope you enjoyed
this video , let me know your thoughts in

1387.text:
the comments below and make sure to subscribe
to LondonCityGirl for more film analysis videos.

1393.text: Thanks for stopping by and supporting my channel and I'll see you next time! :)
